histore.document.base module¶

Documents are wrappers around different forms of snapshots that may be committed to an archive. A document primarily serves two purposes: (1) it contains the document schema (a list of column names), and (2) it supports reading the document rows.

class histore.document.base.Document(columns: List[Union[str, histore.document.schema.Column]])¶

Bases: histore.document.base.InputStream

The abstract document class maintains the document schema and provides access to the document rows via a document iterator.

abstract close()¶

Signal that processing of the document is finished.

Any resources that were created by the document (e.g., temporary files) can be released.

iterrows() → Iterator[Tuple[Union[int, float, str, datetime.datetime, Tuple[Union[int, float, str, datetime.datetime], …]], List[Union[int, float, str, datetime.datetime]]]]¶

Simulate the iterrows() function of a pandas DataFrame.

Returns an iterator that yields pairs of row index and row value lists for each row in the streamed data frame.

Returns

Return type

iterator

abstract open() → histore.document.base.DocumentIterator¶

Open the document to get a iterator for the rows in the document.

Returns

Return type

histore.document.base.DocumentIterator

abstract read_df() → pandas.core.frame.DataFrame¶

Create data frame from the document rows.

Returns

Return type

pd.DataFrame

abstract sorted(keys: List[int], buffersize: Optional[float] = None) → histore.document.base.Document¶

Sort the document rows based on the values in the key columns.

Key columns are specified by their index position. Returns a new document.

Parameters

  • keys (list of int) – Index position of sort columns.

  • buffersize (float, default=None) – Maximum size (in bytes) of file blocks that are kept in main-memory.

Returns

Return type

histore.document.base.Document

class histore.document.base.DocumentIterator¶

Bases: object

Iterator over rows in a document. Each row is represented as a list of cell values for the document columns. Cell values are expected to be scalar values. In addition to the cell values, for each row the iterator provides access to the row position in the document (starting at 0) and the row index. The row index is used as the row key when merging documents into archives that are not keyed by a primary key.

For most external documents the row position and the row index will be the same value. Documents that represent pandas.DataFrame objects, on the other hand, will use the value from the data frame index for each row as the returned row index.

abstract close()¶

Release all resources that are held by the iterator.

abstract has_next() → bool¶

Test if the iterator has more rows to read. If the result is True then the next() method will return the next row. Otherwise, the next() method will raise a StopIteration error.

Returns

Return type

bool

abstract next() → Tuple[int, Union[int, float, str, datetime.datetime, Tuple[Union[int, float, str, datetime.datetime], …]], List[Union[int, float, str, datetime.datetime]]]¶

Read the next row in the document.

Returns the row position, row index and the list of cell values for each of the document columns. Raises a StopIteration error if an attempt is made to read past the end of the document.

Returns

Return type

tuple of int, histore.document.base.RowIndex, histore.document.base.DataRow

Bases: object

class histore.document.base.InputStream(columns: List[Union[str, histore.document.schema.Column]])¶

Bases: object

Abstract class for data input streams. An input stream contains informaton about the schema of the stream rows. The input stream is an iterator over rows in the dataset.
